Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the percentage of uninsured Americans who make more than $50,000 a year.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the data does not show that half of the uninsured Americans make more than $50,000 a year.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the main reason uninsured Americans do not buy insurance is because of the expense, without considering other factors.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the variation in data, which is the difference between household and individual income levels.
